attributes.action: Postpone the Easter bank holidays, hold later as NHS/ keyworker appreciation day
attributes.additional_details:
There is no point having bank holidays at Easter 2020. People will either be at work because they’re keyworkers or at home without friends and in many cases without family. 
Holding them later in the year would allow people a way to show our appreciation of the NHS and other keyworkers.
attributes.background: Postpone the two bank holidays for Easter 2020 until a time when they can be celebrated and appreciated. They, or at least one of them should be appreciation days for the NHS/other keyworkers.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309243
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303882

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
